72 /** Trace state machine changes for a particular request
73  *
74  */
75 typedef struct {
76  fr_dlist_head_t *log_head; //!< To allow the log entry to remove itself on free.
77  fr_dlist_t entry; //!< Entry in the linked list.
78  fr_trunk_request_state_t from; //!< What state we transitioned from.
79  fr_trunk_request_state_t to; //!< What state we transitioned to.
80 
81  fr_trunk_connection_t *tconn; //!< The request was associated with.
82  ///< Pointer may now be invalid, do no de-reference.
83 
84  uint64_t tconn_id; //!< If the treq was associated with a connection
85  ///< the connection ID.
86  fr_trunk_connection_state_t tconn_state; //!< If the treq was associated with a connection
87  ///< the connection state at the time of the
88  ///< state transition.
89 
90  char const *function; //!< State change occurred in.
91  int line; //!< Line change occurred on.
92 } fr_trunk_request_state_log_t;
93 #endif
94 
95 /** Wraps a normal request
96  *
97  */
98 struct fr_trunk_request_s {
99  struct fr_trunk_request_pub_s pub; //!< Public fields in the trunk request.
100  ///< This *MUST* be the first field in this
101  ///< structure.
102 
103  uint64_t id; //!< Trunk request ID.
104 
105  int32_t heap_id; //!< Used to track the request conn->pending heap.
106 
107  fr_dlist_t entry; //!< Used to track the trunk request in the conn->sent
108  ///< or trunk->backlog request.
109 
110  fr_trunk_cancel_reason_t cancel_reason; //!< Why this request was cancelled.
111 
112  fr_time_t last_freed; //!< Last time this request was freed.
113 
114  bool bound_to_conn; //!< Fail the request if there's an attempt to
115  ///< re-enqueue it.
116 
117 #ifndef NDEBUG
118  fr_dlist_head_t log; //!< State change log.
119 #endif
120 };

123 /** Associates request queues with a connection
124  *
125  * @dotfile src/lib/server/trunk_conn.gv "Trunk connection state machine"
126  */
127 struct fr_trunk_connection_s {
128  struct fr_trunk_connection_pub_s pub; //!< Public fields in the trunk connection.
129  ///< This *MUST* be the first field in this
130  ///< structure.
131 
132  int32_t heap_id; //!< Used to track the connection in the connected
133  ///< heap.
134 
135  fr_dlist_t entry; //!< Used to track the connection in the connecting,
136  ///< full and failed lists.
137 
138  /** @name State
139  * @{
140  */
141  fr_trunk_connection_event_t events; //!< The current events we expect to be notified on.
142  /** @} */
143 
144  /** @name Request lists
145  * @{
146  */
147  fr_heap_t *pending; //!< Requests waiting to be sent.
148 
149  fr_trunk_request_t *partial; //!< Partially written request.
150 
151  fr_dlist_head_t sent; //!< Sent request.
152 
153  fr_dlist_head_t cancel; //!< Requests in the cancel state.
154 
155  fr_trunk_request_t *cancel_partial; //!< Partially written cancellation request.
156 
157  fr_dlist_head_t cancel_sent; //!< Sent cancellation request.
158  /** @} */
159 
160  /** @name Statistics
161  * @{
162  */
163  uint64_t sent_count; //!< The number of requests that have been sent using
164  ///< this connection.
165  /** @} */
166 
167  /** @name Timers
168  * @{
169  */
170  fr_event_timer_t const *lifetime_ev; //!< Maximum time this connection can be open.
171  /** @} */
172 };
173 
174 /** Main trunk management handle
175  *
176  */
177 struct fr_trunk_s {
178  struct fr_trunk_pub_s pub; //!< Public fields in the trunk connection.
179  ///< This *MUST* be the first field in this
180  ///< structure.
181 
182  char const *log_prefix; //!< What to prepend to messages.
183 
184  fr_event_list_t *el; //!< Event list used by this trunk and the connection.
185 
186  fr_trunk_conf_t conf; //!< Trunk common configuration.
187 
188  fr_dlist_head_t free_requests; //!< Requests in the unassigned state. Waiting to be
189  ///< enqueued.
190 
191  fr_heap_t *backlog; //!< The request backlog. Requests we couldn't
192  ///< immediately assign to a connection.
193 
194  /** @name Connection lists
195  *
196  * A connection must always be in exactly one of these lists
197  * or trees.
198  *
199  * @{
200  */
201  fr_dlist_head_t init; //!< Connections which have not yet started
202  ///< connecting.
203 
204  fr_dlist_head_t connecting; //!< Connections which are not yet in the open state.
205 
206  fr_heap_t *active; //!< Connections which can service requests.
207 
208  fr_dlist_head_t full; //!< Connections which have too many outstanding
209  ///< requests.
210 
211  fr_dlist_head_t inactive; //!< Connections which have been signalled to be
212  ///< inactive by the API client.
213 
214  fr_dlist_head_t inactive_draining; //!< Connections which have been signalled to be
215  ///< inactive by the API client, which the trunk
216  ///< manager is draining to close.
217 
218  fr_dlist_head_t failed; //!< Connections that'll be reconnected shortly.
219 
220  fr_dlist_head_t closed; //!< Connections that have closed. Either due to
221  ///< shutdown, reconnection or failure.
222 
223  fr_dlist_head_t draining; //!< Connections that will be freed once all their
224  ///< requests are complete, but can be reactivated.
225 
226  fr_dlist_head_t draining_to_free; //!< Connections that will be freed once all their
227  ///< requests are complete.
228 
229  fr_dlist_head_t to_free; //!< Connections we're done with and will free on
230  //!< the next call to trunk_manage.
231  //!< This prevents connections from being freed
232  //!< whilst we're inside callbacks.
233  /** @} */
234 
235  /** @name Callbacks
236  * @{
237  */
238  fr_trunk_io_funcs_t funcs; //!< I/O functions.
239 
240  void *in_handler; //!< Which handler we're inside.
241 
242  void *uctx; //!< Uctx data to pass to alloc.
243  /** @} */
244 
245  /** @name Timers
246  * @{
247  */
248  fr_event_timer_t const *manage_ev; //!< Periodic connection management event.
249  /** @} */
250 
251  /** @name Log rate limiting entries
252  * @{
253  */
254  fr_rate_limit_t limit_max_requests_alloc_log; //!< Rate limit on "Refusing to alloc requests - Limit of * requests reached"
255 
256  fr_rate_limit_t limit_last_failure_log; //!< Rate limit on "Refusing to enqueue requests - No active conns"
257  /** @} */
258 
259  /** @name State
260  * @{
261  */
262  bool freeing; //!< Trunk is being freed, don't spawn new
263  ///< connections or re-enqueue.
264 
265  bool started; //!< Has the trunk been started.
266 
267  bool managing_connections; //!< Whether the trunk is allowed to manage
268  ///< (open/close) connections.
269 
270  uint64_t last_req_per_conn; //!< The last request to connection ratio we calculated.
271  /** @} */
272 };

313 static fr_table_num_indexed_bit_pos_t const fr_trunk_req_trigger_names[] = {
314  { L("pool.request_init"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_INIT }, /* 0x0000 - bit 0 */
315  { L("pool.request_unassigned"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_UNASSIGNED }, /* 0x0001 - bit 1 */
316  { L("pool.request_backlog"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_BACKLOG }, /* 0x0002 - bit 2 */
317  { L("pool.request_pending"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_PENDING }, /* 0x0004 - bit 3 */
318  { L("pool.request_partial"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_PARTIAL }, /* 0x0008 - bit 4 */
319  { L("pool.request_sent"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_SENT }, /* 0x0010 - bit 5 */
320  { L("pool.request_complete"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_COMPLETE }, /* 0x0020 - bit 6 */
321  { L("pool.request_state_failed"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_FAILED }, /* 0x0040 - bit 7 */
322  { L("pool.request_state_cancel"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_CANCEL }, /* 0x0080 - bit 8 */
323  { L("pool.request_state_cancel_sent"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_CANCEL_SENT }, /* 0x0100 - bit 9 */
324  { L("pool.request_state_cancel_partial"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_CANCEL_PARTIAL }, /* 0x0200 - bit 10 */
325  { L("pool.request_state_cancel_complete"), FR_TRUNK_REQUEST_STATE_CANCEL_COMPLETE } /* 0x0400 - bit 11 */
326 };
327 static size_t fr_trunk_req_trigger_names_len = NUM_ELEMENTS(fr_trunk_req_trigger_names);
328 #endif

394 #define CONN_TRIGGER(_state) do { \
395  if (trunk->pub.triggers) { \
396  trigger_exec(NULL, NULL, fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_conn_trigger_names, _state, \
397  "<INVALID>"), true, NULL); \
398  } \
399 } while (0)
400 
401 #define CONN_STATE_TRANSITION(_new, _log) \
402 do { \
403  _log("[%" PRIu64 "] Trunk connection changed state %s -> %s", \
404  tconn->pub.conn->id, \
405  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_connection_states, tconn->pub.state, "<INVALID>"), \
406  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_connection_states, _new, "<INVALID>")); \
407  tconn->pub.state = _new; \
408  CONN_TRIGGER(_new); \
409  trunk_requests_per_connection(NULL, NULL, trunk, fr_time(), false); \
410 } while (0)
411 
412 #define CONN_BAD_STATE_TRANSITION(_new) \
413 do { \
414  if (!fr_cond_assert_msg(0, "[%" PRIu64 "] Trunk connection invalid transition %s -> %s", \
415  tconn->pub.conn->id, \
416  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_connection_states, tconn->pub.state, "<INVALID>"), \
417  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_connection_states, _new, "<INVALID>"))) return; \
418 } while (0)

420 #ifndef NDEBUG
421 void trunk_request_state_log_entry_add(char const *function, int line,
422  fr_trunk_request_t *treq, fr_trunk_request_state_t new) CC_HINT(nonnull);
423 
424 #define REQUEST_TRIGGER(_state) do { \
425  if (trunk->pub.triggers) { \
426  trigger_exec(NULL, NULL, fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_req_trigger_names, _state, \
427  "<INVALID>"), true, NULL); \
428  } \
429 } while (0)
430 
431 /** Record a request state transition and log appropriate output
432  *
433  */
434 #define REQUEST_STATE_TRANSITION(_new) \
435 do { \
436  DEBUG3("Trunk request %" PRIu64 " changed state %s -> %s", \
437  treq->id, \
438  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, treq->pub.state, "<INVALID>"), \
439  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, _new, "<INVALID>")); \
440  trunk_request_state_log_entry_add(__FUNCTION__, __LINE__, treq, _new); \
441  treq->pub.state = _new; \
442  REQUEST_TRIGGER(_new); \
443 } while (0)
444 #define REQUEST_BAD_STATE_TRANSITION(_new) \
445 do { \
446  fr_trunk_request_state_log(&default_log, L_ERR, __FILE__, __LINE__, treq); \
447  if (!fr_cond_assert_msg(0, "Trunk request %" PRIu64 " invalid transition %s -> %s", \
448  treq->id, \
449  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, treq->pub.state, "<INVALID>"), \
450  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, _new, "<INVALID>"))) return; \
451 } while (0)
452 #else
453 /** Record a request state transition
454  *
455  */
456 #define REQUEST_STATE_TRANSITION(_new) \
457 do { \
458  DEBUG3("Trunk request %" PRIu64 " changed state %s -> %s", \
459  treq->id, \
460  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, treq->pub.state, "<INVALID>"), \
461  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, _new, "<INVALID>")); \
462 } while (0)
463 #define REQUEST_BAD_STATE_TRANSITION(_new) \
464 do { \
465  if (!fr_cond_assert_msg(0, "Trunk request %" PRIu64 " invalid transition %s -> %s", \
466  treq->id, \
467  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, treq->pub.state, "<INVALID>"), \
468  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, _new, "<INVALID>"))) return; \
469 } while (0)
470 #endif

472 
473 /** Call the cancel callback if set
474  *
475  */
476 #define DO_REQUEST_CANCEL(_treq, _reason) \
477 do { \
478  if ((_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_cancel) { \
479  void *_prev = (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
480  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_cancel; \
481  DEBUG3("Calling request_cancel(conn=%p, preq=%p, reason=%s, uctx=%p)", (_treq)->pub.tconn->pub.conn, (_treq)->pub.preq, fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_cancellation_reasons, (_reason), "<INVALID>"), (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
482  (_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_cancel((_treq)->pub.tconn->pub.conn, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_reason), (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
483  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
484  } \
485 } while(0)
486 
487 /** Call the "conn_release" callback (if set)
488  *
489  */
490 #define DO_REQUEST_CONN_RELEASE(_treq) \
491 do { \
492  if ((_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_conn_release) { \
493  void *_prev = (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
494  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_conn_release; \
495  DEBUG3("Calling request_conn_release(conn=%p, preq=%p, uctx=%p)", (_treq)->pub.tconn->pub.conn, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
496  (_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_conn_release((_treq)->pub.tconn->pub.conn, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
497  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
498  } \
499 } while(0)
500 
501 /** Call the complete callback (if set)
502  *
503  */
504 #define DO_REQUEST_COMPLETE(_treq) \
505 do { \
506  if ((_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_complete) { \
507  void *_prev = (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
508  DEBUG3("Calling request_complete(request=%p, preq=%p, rctx=%p, uctx=%p)", (_treq)->pub.request, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_treq)->pub.rctx, (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
509  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_complete; \
510  (_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_complete((_treq)->pub.request, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_treq)->pub.rctx, (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
511  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
512  } \
513 } while(0)
514 
515 /** Call the fail callback (if set)
516  *
517  */
518 #define DO_REQUEST_FAIL(_treq, _prev_state) \
519 do { \
520  if ((_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_fail) { \
521  void *_prev = (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
522  DEBUG3("Calling request_fail(request=%p, preq=%p, rctx=%p, state=%s uctx=%p)", (_treq)->pub.request, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_treq)->pub.rctx, fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_request_states, (_prev_state), "<INVALID>"), (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
523  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_fail; \
524  (_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_fail((_treq)->pub.request, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_treq)->pub.rctx, _prev_state, (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
525  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
526  } \
527 } while(0)
528 
529 /** Call the free callback (if set)
530  *
531  */
532 #define DO_REQUEST_FREE(_treq) \
533 do { \
534  if ((_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_free) { \
535  void *_prev = (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
536  DEBUG3("Calling request_free(request=%p, preq=%p, uctx=%p)", (_treq)->pub.request, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
537  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_free; \
538  (_treq)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_free((_treq)->pub.request, (_treq)->pub.preq, (_treq)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
539  (_treq)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
540  } \
541 } while(0)
542 
543 /** Write one or more requests to a connection
544  *
545  */
546 #define DO_REQUEST_MUX(_tconn) \
547 do { \
548  void *_prev = (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
549  DEBUG3("[%" PRIu64 "] Calling request_mux(el=%p, tconn=%p, conn=%p, uctx=%p)", \
550  (_tconn)->pub.conn->id, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->el, (_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.conn, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
551  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_mux; \
552  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_mux((_tconn)->pub.trunk->el, (_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.conn, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
553  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
554 } while(0)
555 
556 /** Read one or more requests from a connection
557  *
558  */
559 #define DO_REQUEST_DEMUX(_tconn) \
560 do { \
561  void *_prev = (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
562  DEBUG3("[%" PRIu64 "] Calling request_demux(tconn=%p, conn=%p, uctx=%p)", \
563  (_tconn)->pub.conn->id, (_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.conn, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
564  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_demux; \
565  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_demux((_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.conn, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
566  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
567 } while(0)
568 
569 /** Write one or more cancellation requests to a connection
570  *
571  */
572 #define DO_REQUEST_CANCEL_MUX(_tconn) \
573 do { \
574  if ((_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_cancel_mux) { \
575  void *_prev = (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
576  DEBUG3("[%" PRIu64 "] Calling request_cancel_mux(tconn=%p, conn=%p, uctx=%p)", \
577  (_tconn)->pub.conn->id, (_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.conn, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
578  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_cancel_mux; \
579  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.request_cancel_mux((_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.conn, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
580  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
581  } \
582 } while(0)
583 
584 /** Allocate a new connection
585  *
586  */
587 #define DO_CONNECTION_ALLOC(_tconn) \
588 do { \
589  void *_prev = trunk->in_handler; \
590  DEBUG3("Calling connection_alloc(tconn=%p, el=%p, conf=%p, log_prefix=\"%s\", uctx=%p)", \
591  (_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.trunk->el, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->conf.conn_conf, trunk->log_prefix, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
592  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *) (_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.connection_alloc; \
593  (_tconn)->pub.conn = trunk->funcs.connection_alloc((_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.trunk->el, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->conf.conn_conf, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->log_prefix, trunk->uctx); \
594  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
595  if (!(_tconn)->pub.conn) { \
596  ERROR("Failed creating new connection"); \
597  talloc_free(tconn); \
598  return -1; \
599  } \
600 } while(0)

602 /** Change what events the connection should be notified about
603  *
604  */
605 #define DO_CONNECTION_NOTIFY(_tconn, _events) \

608  void *_prev = (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler; \
609  DEBUG3("[%" PRIu64 "] Calling connection_notify(tconn=%p, conn=%p, el=%p, events=%s, uctx=%p)", \
610  (_tconn)->pub.conn->id, (_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.conn, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->el, \
611  fr_table_str_by_value(fr_trunk_connection_events, (_events), "<INVALID>"), (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
612  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = (void *)(_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.connection_notify; \
613  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->funcs.connection_notify((_tconn), (_tconn)->pub.conn, (_tconn)->pub.trunk->el, (_events), (_tconn)->pub.trunk->uctx); \
614  (_tconn)->pub.trunk->in_handler = _prev; \
615  } \
616 } while(0)

618 #define IN_HANDLER(_trunk) (((_trunk)->in_handler) != NULL)
619 #define IN_REQUEST_MUX(_trunk) (((_trunk)->funcs.request_mux) && ((_trunk)->in_handler == (void *)(_trunk)->funcs.request_mux))
620 #define IN_REQUEST_DEMUX(_trunk) (((_trunk)->funcs.request_demux) && ((_trunk)->in_handler == (void *)(_trunk)->funcs.request_demux))
621 #define IN_REQUEST_CANCEL_MUX(_trunk) (((_trunk)->funcs.request_cancel_mux) && ((_trunk)->in_handler == (void *)(_trunk)->funcs.request_cancel_mux))

623 #define IS_SERVICEABLE(_tconn) ((_tconn)->pub.state & FR_TRUNK_CONN_SERVICEABLE)

625 /** Remove the current request from the backlog
626  *
627  */
628 #define REQUEST_EXTRACT_BACKLOG(_treq) \
629 do { \
630  int _ret; \
631  _ret = fr_heap_extract((_treq)->pub.trunk->backlog, _treq); \
632  if (!fr_cond_assert_msg(_ret == 0, "Failed extracting conn from backlog heap: %s", fr_strerror())) break; \
633 } while (0)
634 
635 /** Remove the current request from the pending list
636  *
637  */
638 #define REQUEST_EXTRACT_PENDING(_treq) \
639 do { \
640  int _ret; \
641  _ret = fr_heap_extract((_treq)->pub.tconn->pending, _treq); \
642  if (!fr_cond_assert_msg(_ret == 0, "Failed extracting conn from pending heap: %s", fr_strerror())) break; \
643 } while (0)
644 
645 /** Remove the current request from the partial slot
646  *
647  */
648 #define REQUEST_EXTRACT_PARTIAL(_treq) \
649 do { \
650  fr_assert((_treq)->pub.tconn->partial == treq); \
651  tconn->partial = NULL; \
652 } while (0)
653 
654 /** Remove the current request from the sent list
655  *
656  */
657 #define REQUEST_EXTRACT_SENT(_treq) fr_dlist_remove(&tconn->sent, treq);
658 
659 /** Remove the current request from the cancel list
660  *
661  */
662 #define REQUEST_EXTRACT_CANCEL(_treq) fr_dlist_remove(&tconn->cancel, treq);
663 
664 /** Remove the current request from the cancel_partial slot
665  *
666  */
667 #define REQUEST_EXTRACT_CANCEL_PARTIAL(_treq) \
668 do { \
669  fr_assert((_treq)->pub.tconn->cancel_partial == treq); \
670  tconn->cancel_partial = NULL; \
671 } while (0)
672 
673 /** Remove the current request from the cancel sent list
674  *
675  */
676 #define REQUEST_EXTRACT_CANCEL_SENT(_treq) fr_dlist_remove(&tconn->cancel_sent, treq);
677 
678 /** Reorder the connections in the active heap
679  *
680  * fr_heap_extract will also error out if heap_id is bad - no need for assert
681  */
682 #define CONN_REORDER(_tconn) \
683 do { \
684  int _ret; \
685  if ((fr_heap_num_elements((_tconn)->pub.trunk->active) == 1)) break; \
686  if (!fr_cond_assert((_tconn)->pub.state == FR_TRUNK_CONN_ACTIVE)) break; \
687  _ret = fr_heap_extract((_tconn)->pub.trunk->active, (_tconn)); \
688  if (!fr_cond_assert_msg(_ret == 0, "Failed extracting conn from active heap: %s", fr_strerror())) break; \
689  fr_heap_insert((_tconn)->pub.trunk->active, (_tconn)); \
690 } while (0)
